    Report reveals over 130 criminal gangs operating in Nairobi

    By Zawadi Intel Staff | Dec 1, 2025

    The Interior Ministry has revealed that over 130 criminal gangs are currently active in Nairobi, disrupting law and order in the capital. The report underscores the scale of organized crime affecting urban safety and governance.

    Government Response

    Authorities are intensifying efforts to dismantle these groups through targeted operations and community engagement. Police units have been deployed to hotspots, while intelligence teams track gang networks across the city.

    Expert Analysis

    Security experts warn that unchecked gang proliferation could undermine economic development and social stability. They emphasize the need for coordinated strategies that combine law enforcement with social programs.

    Community Impact

    Residents report rising insecurity in neighborhoods, with extortion and violence becoming more frequent. Public awareness campaigns and rehabilitation programs are proposed as long-term solutions to reintegrate youth and reduce recruitment into gangs.

    Policy Recommendations

    The findings call for enhanced policing, inter-agency cooperation, and stronger judicial frameworks to restore order. Civil society groups are urging the government to balance enforcement with rehabilitation to avoid further marginalization.
